intro: Poikilospermum inaequale, commonly known as the variable seed plant, is a unique species characterized by its distinctive seed morphology. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to certain regions of Africa. The plant exhibits a range of morphological variations, particularly in its seeds, which display irregular shapes and colors. These variations are thought to be adaptations to specific environmental conditions. Due to its rarity and unique features, it is of interest to botanists studying plant diversity and evolution.
